Trial_Design.evidence: patients ≥60 yr old undergoing elective noncardiac surgery were randomly assigned

Participants.evidence: patients ≥60 yr old undergoing elective noncardiac surgery

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned either to stop or continue RAS inhibitors before surgery

Objective.evidence: We hypothesised that stopping RAS inhibitors before surgery increases the risk of perioperative myocardial injury

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome, masked to investigators, clinicians, and patients, was myocardial injury...within 48 h after surgery

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomly assigned either to stop or continue RAS inhibitors before surgery

Blinding.evidence: masked to investigators, clinicians, and patients

Number_Analysed.evidence: Myocardial injury occurred in 63/101 (62.4%) subjects with NT-proBNP >100 pg ml −1 , compared with 45/140 (32.1%) subjects with NT-proBNP <100 pg ml −1
